Headquartered in Singapore, BandLab Technologies is a collective of global music brands with a vision to connect the world of music. We bring together remarkable brands and people that are passionate about music, and we seek to leverage the opportunities that allow us to achieve more together than we can individually. We believe that integrating the physical, digital and social supply chain around music will create better experiences and opportunities for musicians and fans. BandLab is the flagship digital product in BandLab Technologies’ collective of music brands, and a leading social music creation platform with a global reach of over 40 million users, and growing quickly. Through its best-in-class digital audio workstation (DAW), BandLab empowers creators to make music and share their creative process with musicians and fans on an unprecedented level. We are seeking a goal-oriented regional marketing manager to implement marketing campaigns in accordance with the region's demographics. In this role, you will be responsible for developing online and offline marketing strategies for the Asia region. This role reports to the Head of Marketing. Your main responsibilities are: Gain in-depth understanding of market potential and segment-specific customer needs in Asia markets. Recommend and execute on marketing strategies for specific cities and countries within Asia. Analyzing local competition and strengthening the BandLab’s brand position in assigned regional areas. Supervising and developing the regional marketing budget. Developing a clear understanding of the financial goals in a region and the key success indicators. Working with the Head of Marketing to formulate and supervise the regional marketing budget. Evaluating productivity and marketing strategies’ return on investment (ROI). Requirements Minimum of 7 years of work experience as a Regional Marketing Manager or Partnerships Manager in the Asia region. Extensive knowledge of marketing strategies, omni-channel marketing, and curating offline events in key markets. Ability to build strategic relationships and partner with key industry players, agencies, and vendors within the region. Data driven and analytical at the core. Should be natural at building dashboards and analyzing data to access the success of different campaigns. Deep knowledge of 2-3 scalable channels is a strong plus. Ability to build landing pages using WYSIWYG tools and writing great copy is a plus. Interest in taking ownership of metrics and a do whatever it takes to execute attitude. Organized & self-motivated. You hold yourself accountable for your decisions and meet deadlines when presented. You are always searching for the best solution. A good communicator. You are able to clearly communicate your ideas and maintain communication channels effectively through lengthy projects and multiple stakeholders. Humble and objective. You are able to provide, receive, and incorporate constructive feedback. A passion for music is a must, and music production knowledge is a PLUS! Benefits Healthcare, dental insurance Attractive paid annual leave, sick leave, childcare leave, volunteer leave and maternity leave Cozy working place with modern workstations/remote work options Corporate benefits at select retail and F&B outlets

You’ll work cross-functionally with GrabFood Leaders from the SMB team, Marketing, Campaigns and Demand Operations to package compelling solutions & identify new client opportunities. Get to know the team: Have you ever wanted to build customer-facing products that rely extensively on data insights and models? Have you ever been keen on building a recommender model to customise your Grab app (or any other consumer app) experience? If you answered yes to either of these questions .. then look no further! The Analytics team mission is to use data and experimentation to advance product innovation. We love building hacky products to test and iterate what’s best for our customers. As we ship multiple products every week, it means we have to fine-tune models, run and evaluate hundreds of experiments weekly! We are looking for junior and experienced data scientists to build a center of data excellence for Product & Experimentation in a diverse range of tech families. Your role is to guide a data-first approach to product thinking, design controlled experiments and be objective while evaluating results, all of this while working with stakeholders to evaluate new and innovative product and business ideas! You will help developers, designers & product managers across the company with recommendations on how to learn from unexpected results, study underlying causes for them and iterate on the next set of products to build for our users. What Will You Do? You will be working closely with various teams within a business line (Product, Business, Engineering, Design and Data Science) to understand data requirements, identify and track key metrics, and provide data-driven insights. You will also work with stakeholders to evaluate the feasibility of new business/product ideas and provide appropriate recommendations. A Day In The Life Understand business objectives and deepdive into existing data to recommend new product ideas to solve for the most impactful customer problems (pssh .. some top-secret products await you!) Use data to identify trends, spot anomalies and deepdive into their root causes Use your number-crunching and slide-maker skills to use and present data beyond just numbers. Hone your data storytelling skills through visualisation techniques by building dashboards and presenting insights to a non-technical audience! Evaluate the feasibility of developing new products, participate in user researches to validate customer problems Align with stakeholders on key product metrics, design and propose experimentation strategies. Launch A/B tests, analyze experiment results and provide recommendations Design and own frontend and backend data specs for new products, while collaborating with engineering teams to ensure accurate and timely data collection Develop and maintain data pipelines to fulfill product reporting requirements The Must Haves A curious and confident soul (with a dash of humour) who loves using data! For Data Scientists, some relevant experience and for Senior Data Scientists, 2-3+ years relevant industry experience (preferably in an Internet or ‘Direct to Consumer’ company with high velocity data and scaled controlled experiments). Prior experience with Product Management will be a definite plus. Strong statistical knowledge - ideally having utilized controlled experiments in the industry. You enjoy using SQL, Google Sheets, R, SQL and other scripting/programming languages to solve customer-problems. Experience in Spark (Scala / pySpark) would be a plus. Strong data visualization and storytelling skills. Experience in creating dashboards using Tableau and other visualisation tools. Self-Starter: Ability to work independently and drive own projects. Ability to deliver on tight timelines and move quickly with cross-functional teams to execute on decisions while maintaining attention to detail

ESG Analyst (Sustainable Finance), Singapore Department Overview Part of Fitch Ratings (and Fitch Group), the Sustainable Finance Group (SUF) is focused on research and analysis of ESG themes for companies and their debt instruments. The group currently has 4 primary teams, ESG Research, ESG Integration and Reporting, ESG Analytics (Credit Ratings), and ESG Product Development. The department, currently composed by 30 professionals spread worldwide (Europe/UK, US, Latam, and Asia) with a varied background, is expanding to take on new activities. Following the successful development of the ESG Ratings, SUF is looking to create a fifth team - the ESG Rating team - to produce, monitor and maintain ESG Ratings on debt instruments and entities. Job Description Fitch Sustainable Finance is looking for highly motivated and passionate analysts (starting February 2022) to be trained in the new rating methodology and then to deliver quality research and analytical products to our clients worldwide. The role entails the delivery of high-quality, timely, focused analysis on a suite of products related to the ESG credentials and performance of entities and fixed income issuances . The person will work alongside peers in a team and be assigned a varied portfolio of companies and associated debt instruments to analyse and monitor. He or she will have to present and discuss internally (and externally) his/her findings and the related outputs. Knowledge and understanding of current Sustainability/ESG themes and standards is a key requirement for the role . Desired Skills The person will... have direct and in-depth knowledge (and expertise) of Environmental and/or Social and/or Governance themes for Corporates and/or Financial Institutions and/or Structured Finance. be curious and demonstrate an ability to rapidly assimilate knowledge and information, and then apply it to identify trends, themes, perform analysis and draw conclusions from data. have direct knowledge and/or experience of at least 1 specific industry sector (e.g. Energy, Building, Transportation, commercial banking, ABS) have a good understanding of how the fixed income and capital markets function, including some knowledge of bond and loan structures be able to write concise reports and deliver analyses/research papers in English be a self-starter, with a focus for detail, execution, and workload prioritization be resourceful, flexible and able to work independently in remote / WFH (under Covid-19) circumstances be able to cooperate seamlessly in a team based, international set-up, with a strong focus on common goals and objectives be able, and willing, to learn from mistakes as well as to provide and accept constructive criticism Qualifications/Requirements The person will... have at least 2 years of work experience preferably in a research or analytical environment be a graduate in a discipline with a technical background related to any of Environmental science, Social risk or Governance themed disciplines, or Economics/Business/Finance be financially literate and comfortable working with and drawing conclusions from data have good knowledge of Microsoft Office (Powerpoint, Excel, Word, Access) be fluent in English (written and spoken). Detailed knowledge of an additional language such as Japanese, Korean, German, French, Italian will be beneficial What we offer The right candidate will receive: a competitive salary (based on experience and skills) a discretionary bonus based on corporate and individual performance and goals achieved following a probation period, a generous benefits package (annual leave, annual volunteer working days, non-contributory pension, medical insurance, parental leave, etc) #LI-VC1

Get to know the team Grab - the leading super app in Southeast Asia - combines transport, food delivery, logistics, payments, and much more in a single platform. The Driver Experience department dedicates to delivering best-in-class products and experiences to our driver partners, to increase adoption and engagement of our services. Our Data Science team is a long-established core group responsible for Supply Shaping. Harnessing the power of big data and advanced ML methods, we build AI products which help our driver partners work more efficiently and ensure our platform can better serve our consumers. If you are looking for an opportunity to make an impact on the lives of millions of Grab driver partners across South East Asia, then you should join our team! Responsibilities Collaborate with cross functional teams to define business problem, scope out product development, deliver solution, and validate product impacts Explore and develop novel models and algorithms by employing operations research / machine learning / statistics / probability / economics techniques Effectively conceptualize analyses and communicate to business/product stakeholders Build, deploy and own production-grade services Contribute to team's innovation and IP creation Mentor junior team members The Must-Haves Master’s degree (Ph.D. strongly preferred) in Computer Science, Electrical/Computer Engineering, Industrial & Systems Engineering, Operations Research, Mathematics/Statistics, or related technical disciplines with 3+ years of DS work at a technology company; or equivalent experience Strong Machine Learning fundamentals: Experience in developing ML systems from end to end, including exploratory data analysis, feature engineering, hyperparameter tuning, model training / evaluation / inference, etc. Understanding of ML algorithms such as neural networks, decision trees, boosting techniques, reinforcement learning. Strong software development skills: Excellent software development capabilities, preferably in Python; knowledge of GoLang or Scala would be an advantage Experience with at least one of distributed data processing frameworks (e.g., hadoop, spark, flink, etc.) ○ Experience with spinning up, deploying and maintaining microservices to serve DS/ML models Familiar with Git-based version control, cloud-based development (AWS/Azure) Self-motivated, independent learner, and willing to share knowledge with team members Ability to work in a dynamic and fast-paced working environment while maintaining attention to detail and efficient time management Excellent communication skills, ability to translate complex technical details for non-technical audiences

Get to know the role: Explore and extract insights from massive dataset of geospatial, behavioural, economic, and the interaction of millions of passengers and drivers and millions of rides per day from more than 65 cities across the region Build, validate, test, and deploy machine learning or other data science models to predict and influence the behaviour of supply and demand with the goal of optimising system efficiency of the platform The day-to-day activities: Develop creative algorithms by employing machine learning and other data science techniques Contribute to team’s innovation and IP creation Collaborate with other data scientists, software engineers, and business operation teams The must haves: Ph.D. graduate, or Masters Degree graduate with at least 3 years of experience, in Computer Science, Economics, Electrical/Computer Engineering, Operations Research, or Mathematics/Statistics Understanding of machine learning, deep learning, data mining, algorithmic foundations of optimization Experience with machine learning framework (scikit-learn, Spark MLlib etc) Proficient in one or more of the following programming languages: Python, Scala. Experience with one or more big data processing frameworks such as Spark Self-motivated, independent learner, and willing to share knowledge with team members Detail-oriented and efficient time manage in a dynamic working environment

Hiring_Company: Asia Investor Group on Climate Change
Job_Descriptions: Role description & responsibilities This role will be responsible for conducting analysis and co-ordinating up to 10 Asian focus company engagements in the Energy Sector within the Climate Action 100+ initiative. The analyst will be tasked with supporting investors in their engagement with the companies to meet climate goals and be in alignment with goals of the Paris Agreement and that of the initiative. This will include day-to-day engagement co-ordination, tracking and monitoring of investor signatory activity, rolling out of global projects at Asian markets, and assisting with signatory research needs. Typical areas of research include the benchmarking of a company’s performance against peer companies in its transition to low carbon and/or net zero, identifying sectoral decarbonisation pathways relevant to focus companies. The role reports to the Director of Engagements and will work alongside a peer analyst who will be overseeing other companies and sectors. Analyst experience in the mining sector is a plus. Specific duties include: Engage investor signatories within CA100+ and co-ordinate engagement meetings where necessary. Track and monitor engagement progress across AIGCC Asian focus companies, assist with secretarial duties and identify investor capacity building needs. Actively contribute subject matter expertise in the energy sector and mining sector, and contribute to CA100+ and AIGCC working groups as appropriate. Develop a program of work to rollout projects in Asia, including (but not limited to): Climate Action 100+ Net Zero Company Benchmark Signatory Accountability and Review Development of new indicators to the CA100+ Net Zero Company Benchmark Global Sector Strategies On-boarding new Asian signatories Management of relationships with data providers, NGOs and other key stakeholder as required to deliver the research needs of the initiative. Participation within company engagement groups where appropriate, to deliver insights and contribute to priority setting and evaluation of company performance. Participation as the AIGCC representative on selected global strategic projects and working groups as required to deliver major research, sector strategies and benchmarking projects. Collaborate with other AIGCC initiatives as required. Qualifications and experience Degree in a relevant area - ideally finance, economics and/or environment. At least 5 years of work experience in investment and equities analysis, ESG, shareholder engagement, or corporate sustainability. Experience in working in sectors including oil and gas, electric utilities, mining would be highly regarded. Experience delivering high-quality reports and briefing papers for external stakeholders that draw on significant qualitative and quantitative research. Experience in relationship management and coordinating with partners and/or consultants to deliver a project outcome. Ability to evaluate workload and prioritise projects in a fast-paced, demanding environment. Strong organisational, project management, writing, verbal communication and interpersonal and skills. Fluency in an Asian language (Chinese, Korean, Japanese) is preferrable but not a requirement Able to work well independently and as a team member in remote work settings. Desire to work in a mission-driven and non-profit environment. About Climate Action 100+ The Climate Action 100+ is an initiative led by investors to engage with the world’s largest corporate greenhouse gas emitters to improve their performance in addressing climate change. To date, over 615 investors with more than USD $60 trillion in assets under management have signed on to the initiative. This initiative was developed and launched by five global investor organisations, including the Asia Investor Group on Climate Change, Investor Group on Climate Change, Institutional Investors Group on Climate Change, Ceres and the Principles for Responsible Investment. The Climate Action 100+ Asia and Asia ex-Japan Working Group is comprised of over 100  signatories for Asian-specific engagements.  They engage with 33 focus companies in the region, of which AIGCC coordinates 18 company engagement teams, with PRI managing the other 15. The engagement agenda focuses on improving climate governance, reducing greenhouse gas emissions across the value chain, and disclosure in line with the TCFD framework including scenario analysis. About AIGCC The goal of the Asia Investor Group on Climate Change (AIGCC) is to engage and cooperate with Asia based asset owners, investors and the global investment community around climate finance and investment. The group is a private forum of regional investors with the aim of peer to peer collaboration and learning about the impacts of the risks and opportunities climate change presents to their portfolios. Projects the group undertakes aim to assist in facilitating dialogue and engagement with other Asian investors, companies and regulators in the transition to a low carbon global economy.  Investors in the region are invited from China, Japan, India, South Korea, Singapore, Hong Kong, Taiwan, Indonesia, Malaysia, Thailand, Philippines, Vietnam and the Pacific. Work arrangements and salary This is a full-time 12-month contract position with possibility for extension. This role is based in a major Asian financial centre, operates in a hybrid structure and offers the flexibility to work from home, with regional travel as required where conditions permit. Note: some of the global working groups require attendance at meetings and calls outside of standard business hours. Working in an industry association is about working in a small environment where people's opinions are valued and listened to. We encourage open communication and transparency and promote a dynamic work environment.

We’re growing our Risk Partnerships & Strategy team, which focuses on balancing risk and growth through our partnerships and products across Asia. Stripe’s mission is to increase the GDP of the internet. We build the most powerful and flexible tools for running an internet business. More than 80% of American adults bought something on Stripe in the last year. As part of the Risk Partnerships & Strategy team, you will play a critical role in the company’s financial and partnership health, enabling Stripe’s growth while partnering with internal and external stakeholders to understand and mitigate against key risks. Key responsibilities: Manage key financial partnerships across APAC and in specific countries, including building relationships, understanding requirements, and monitoring risk using a metrics-driven approach Build a close partnership with Financial Partnerships team to understand high-level objectives for partner ecosystem and each partner Drive risk strategy - from scoping to design and execution - to support the launch and growth of Stripe’s new products and markets Develop relationships and work with partners across product, engineering and business teams to prioritize, scope and roll out launches Continue learning about the payments space through industry engagement and independent research, and scale your knowledge to others Our ideal candidate: Has expertise in managing financial partners to defined (and yet to be defined) metrics, balancing growth and risk for Stripe Excels in stakeholder management including navigating difficult situations, negotiating timelines, and influencing internal and external stakeholders across organizations and borders Is analytical, objective and skilled at using metrics to drive decision-making Has project management experience and a proven track record for building and scaling programs from the ground up Has strong collaboration, communication, and relationship building skills and are able to convey complex ideas succinctly to all audiences Has 7-10+ years of professional experience with risk management with partner facing roles preferred Has experience working in tech, or in another fast-paced, high-growth environment Nice to have: Experience in the risk or policy development space

An interesting opportunity to work with a leading technology organisation as their Cloud Architect. This is a permanent opportunity to work with a multinational company. Based in Singapore, our client is a well-established organisation within the technology solutions space. Job_Title: Head of FCC Advisory - Digital Bank
Job_Descriptions: Head of FCC Advisory - Digital Bank We're looking for a Head of Financial Crime Compliance Advisory to work onsite within our new Digital Venture office in Singapore. We're a small venture with bold growth ambitions, offering our staff unique and exciting career development opportunities. We work agilely in project-based sprints in small, interdisciplinary teams. As Head of Financial Crime Compliance Advisory you will acquire new ways of working and be involved in solving a number of interesting challenges, building innovative, industry-leading products and digital journeys for our customers and managing risks intelligently. Job Description You will be responsible for supporting the Chief Compliance Officer, in managing Financial Crime Compliance (FCC) risks, aligning to the Enterprise Risk Management Framework. You will be responsible for the implementation of FCC frameworks, systems, policies and procedures for digital-led banking in Singapore. The Role Responsibility: • Provide advice and training on FCC regulatory requirements, policies and developments. • Oversee the design and end-to-end implementation of appropriate FCC frameworks, systems, controls, policies and procedures for digital-led banking in Singapore, and ensure effective management of issues and risks in collaboration with relevant stakeholders, and compliance with applicable regulations, policies and procedures. • Perform second line of defence role for managing risks relating to Anti-Money Laundering (AML)/ Countering Financing of Terrorism/ Sanctions/ Anti-Bribery and Corruption, report suspicious transactions and escalate issues, as appropriate. • Identify risks and typologies arising from digital-led banking products/ customer segments/ geographies/ transactions. • Understand technical aspects of systems and controls relevant to Customer Due Diligence, Client Risk Assessment, Name and Transaction Screening, Transaction Monitoring/ AML Surveillance, and advise on selection, calibration and tuning of rules and scenarios. • Drive pro-active regulatory engagement and effectively manage regulatory relationships. Our Ideal Candidate: • 12 years of financial sector experience, with more than 7 years in FCC second line of defence role(s). • Possess advanced level of proficiency in FCC regulations, policies and standards. • Able to take the lead, solve problems under pressure, innovate and achieve results sustainably. • Possess strong stakeholder management skills; able to collaborate and communicate effectively. Good to have (Optional): • FCC system implementation experience. • CAMS or relevant ICA certification. • Regulatory/ regulatory liaison experience.

Are you interested in working with cutting-edge laboratory technology to improve quality and accelerate regulatory compliance?  If so, this Analytical Systems Lead role could be an exciting opportunity to explore. As Analytical Systems Lead , you will have responsibility to support the effective operations of all laboratory systems: equipment, Laboratory Information Management System (LIMS), Chromatographic Data System (CDS), IT systems include Laboratory Computerised Systems in both Jurong and Quality Road. This role will provide YOU the opportunity to lead key activities to progress YOUR career, these responsibilities include some of the following: Keep abreast of new testing technologies with the aim to introduce equivalent equipment for support of secure supply activities and for the introduction of new measurement technologies. Lead the management of the laboratory equipment and various IT systems in both Jurong and Quality Road laboratories to ensure that they are maintained and calibrated in accordance to the current GMP and regulatory expectations.  Ensure BCP are in place for critical equipment. Assist Laboratory Operations Manager in supporting laboratory budget management. Ensure consistency for the approaches for the management of laboratory equipment in both Quality Road and Jurong laboratories Ensure a safe working environment for the laboratory and perform 6S inspection. Support the Laboratory Operations Manager in developing laboratory policies and management so as to ensure that the team processes are sufficiently optimized and aligned with the departmental objectives. Supervise, develop, and motivate team members to help realise their maximum potential so as to contribute towards achieving the objectives of the department. Ensure that team members work closely with the laboratory team to ensure that the lab equipment and computer systems are available, in good working order and that they meet regulatory standards. Lead and/or participate in investigations arising from laboratory equipment/computer system events and propose effective CAPA to minimize reoccurrence. Why you? Basic Qualifications: We are looking for professionals with these required skills to achieve our goals: Bachelor’s degree in chemistry or related science discipline with at least 3-5 years experience in analytical environment, or Diploma holder with 5 – 8 years experience in analytical environment. Preferred Qualifications: If you have the following characteristics, it would be a plus: Has experience in pharmaceutical industry Good knowledge of GMP Basic knowledge and on-going awareness of regulatory requirements (includes safety) Very good knowledge of analytical techniques/instruments Good knowledge of manufacturing processes Interpersonal and influencing skills Analytical and logical thinking Leadership and organizational skills Stakeholder engagement Why GSK? Our values and expectations are at the heart of everything we do and form an important part of our culture. These include Patient focus, Transparency, Respect, Integrity along with Courage, Accountability, Development, and Teamwork. As GSK focuses on our values and expectations and a culture of innovation, performance, and trust, the successful candidate will demonstrate the following capabilities: Agile and distributed decision-making – using evidence and applying judgement to balance pace, rigour and risk. Managing individual and team performance. Committed to delivering high quality results, overcoming challenges, focusing on what matters, execution. Implementing change initiatives and leading change. Sustaining energy and well-being, building resilience in teams. Continuously looking for opportunities to learn, build skills and share learning both internally and externally. Developing people and building a talent pipeline. Translating strategy into action - a compelling narrative, motivating others, setting objectives and delegation. Building strong relationships and collaboration, managing trusted stakeholder relationships internally and externally. Budgeting and forecasting, commercial and financial acumen. *LI-GSK Our goal is to be one of the world’s most innovative, best performing and trusted healthcare companies. We believe that we all bring something unique to GSK and when we combine our knowledge, experiences and styles together, the impact is incredible. Come join our adventure at GSK where you will be inspired to do your best work for our patients and consumers. A place where you can be you, feel good and keep growing. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

This includes developing, centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches. Able to work independently with minimum supervision Ability to work in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment Strong problem solving and analytical skills Proven results-oriented person with main focus on delivery Good understanding and experience in standard Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and Agile development methodology. Job_Title: R0144933 CFO - Treasury Finance - Treasury Markets, AVP
Job_Descriptions: Posted by: Sandeep Virothu Recruiter View profile & contact Job Description Summary The Financial, Regulatory and Risk Reporting Specialist ensures timely and accurate financial, regulatory and risk reporting to senior management, regulators, auditors and other relevant stakeholders, in line with regulatory and statutory requirements. They work closely with the Financial, Regulatory and Risk Reporting Managers to provide insight and analysis over the financials and accounts within their remit. Job Description Build, manage and develop relationships with specific key internal stakeholders, critical to the success of the function in line with the Group Finance engagement model Understand stakeholder demand, while providing commercial insight and independent challenge on requirements – through financial, non-financial analysis and knowledge of market best-practice Validation and control over Treasury financial Pool results and outcomes Central point of contact for Treasury Pool Managers into the Finance organization – coordinating and managing the day to day responsibilities for Finance deliveries and insight to Group Treasury Actively drive the delivery of market-leading services to Treasury, through day to day management, RTB excellence and pro-active analysis integration and review of CTB priorities Support the enhancements of the control framework and the management and financial reporting requirements for Treasury under both IFRS and HGB Deliver on the Treasury change book of work as required Additional Job Description Details of the Division and Team: The Treasury Finance function delivers support, insight and advice, as well as, providing independent challenge and monitoring of the performance of the Bank’s Treasury activities and is the central point of contact for Group Treasury into the Finance organization. It establishes, manages and develops internal stakeholder relationships and ensures that the relevant requirements from Treasury are covered in the key products and deliverables. The function includes the further development of the regular evaluation of Treasury performance products and delivers best practice internal reporting to Treasury stakeholders. Your key responsibilities: Build, manage and develop relationships with specific key internal stakeholders, critical to the success of the function in line with the Group Finance engagement model Understand stakeholder demand, while providing commercial insight and independent challenge on requirements – through financial, non-financial analysis and knowledge of market best-practice Validation and control over Treasury’s financial results and outcomes Central point of contact for Treasury TMI function into the Finance organization – coordinating and managing the day to day responsibilities for Finance deliveries and insight to Group Treasury Actively drive the delivery of market-leading services to Treasury, through day to day management, RTB excellence and pro-active analysis integration and review of CTB priorities Support the enhancements of the control framework and the management and financial reporting requirements for Treasury under both IFRS and HGB Deliver on the Treasury change book of work as required Your skills and experience: You will have: A degree plus further qualifications is ideal e.g. qualified accountant. 5-8 years of relevant working experience in Product Control (Risk & PnL) and Financial Control activities within a bank Knowledge of the Treasury function within an investment bank – specifically around the financial and accounting impacts of long term issuance, hedge accounting and associated risk management Excellent analytical and problem solving skills Strong communication skills and are comfortable interacting with a wide range of stakeholders at different corporate titles throughout the APAC region Ability to work collaboratively across Finance to ensure effective and efficient integration of Group Treasury’s requirements Strong control mindset with experience within a daily or monthly control function Sound process and analysis skills Fluent English (oral and written) You will be: Proactive with the ability to work effectively under pressure. Able to manage multiple relationships with demanding stakeholders and be able to work on different projects simultaneously. Results focused with the ability to prioritise a large and varied task list. Proactive with an open work attitude – motivation to develop and enhance processes Strong team player with high ethical standards Flexible – with ability to adapt to rapid change Act with integrity.

The Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies makes a big difference in the health and well-being of people every day. We have more than 250 operating companies in 57 countries employing approximately 114,000 people. Our consumer products and medical devices and diagnostics impact the state of health care for patients, doctors, and nurses around the world. Currently for our Consumer division, we are looking for highly motivated candidate for the position of: Associate Regional Medical Safety Officer Location: Singapore As Associate Regional Medical Safety Officer YOU will: Be a safety specialist who provides safety oversight, in allocated region, for the Consumer portfolio throughout product life cycle including product development to ensure safe and effective products are delivered to our consumers, patients and health care providers. You will report to the Global Medical Stronghold Lead for Skin Health and be part of the Safety Surveillance and Risk Management (SSRM) team within the Office of the Consumer Medical Safety (OCMS) The Medical Safety team in the region is responsible to develop the safety strategy and to oversee the execution of the risk management and Pharmacovigilance activities for all the products licensed/marketed in the region ensuring global alignment and fulfilment of Medical Safety Standards. This includes the development of aggregate safety data assessments, health hazard evaluations of quality issues with potential impact on their safe use, evaluation of safety signals and development of appropriate mitigation. Besides, as RMSO you will collaborate with regional colleagues in R&D, Regulatory, Quality and International Pharmacovigilance team (IPV) and with the Global Medical Safety team. YOUR responsibilities & YOUR impact: Safety evaluations and clinical insights contributing to the completion of the regional safety deliverables for the JJCI portfolio throughout the life cycle. Communication and management of potential and known safety risks A vocal and visible champion of safety insights as a key input into product development and post market safety surveillance strategy Cross-functional collaboration and influence within and outside OCMS Work alongside RMSO to partner and align with regional cross functional business partners. Qualifications Qualifications We would love to hear from YOU, if you have: MD degree is required. Healthcare professional with at least 4 years clinical experience. And A minimum of 2 years of experience in pharmacovigilance/safety related positions (preferred) or other relevant experience (e.g: Medical Affairs; Clinical research) Experience and Skills: Required: Ability to analyze, interpret and present complex scientific data in a concise and understandable scientific manner, both orally and in written format. Attention to detail; Diligence in record-keeping and records organization; Ability to effectively manage time, prioritize responsibilities and meet deadlines is required. Strong collaborative and interpersonal skills; Results-oriented and able to independently create and deliver; Ability to thrive in a global, cross-functional environment Ability to facilitate decision making in collaboration with others. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Computer-literate and proficient in MS Office applications. Preferred: Specialization in dermatology, primary care medicine, public health, epidemiology, or related disciplines desirable Experience in handling a diverse portfolio of medical safety product categories; Experience in clinical/pharmaceutical medicine and also experience in pharmacovigilance; Demonstrated skills/knowledge of regulatory requirements for global pharmacovigilance; Experience in risk evaluation and mitigation; Strong executive presence and presentation skills with the ability to articulate issues and outcomes at executive level Excellent communication and writing skill. Proficiency in Chinese and/or Japanese desirable in order to manage the key stakeholders in Greater China and Japan. In return, we offer: An opportunity to be part of a global market leader. A dynamic and inspiring working environment. Many opportunities to work on challenging projects and assignments. Possibilities for further personal as well as professional development. Many employees benefits. #JNJPhysicians Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. Johnson & Johnson announced plans to separate our Consumer Health business to create a new publicly traded company. The process of the planned separation is anticipated to be completed within 24 months, and it will be subject to legal requirements, and other customary conditions and approvals. Should you accept this position, it is anticipated that, following conclusion of the transaction, you would be an employee of a new entity within New Consumer Health. Primary Location Singapore-Singapore-Singapore- Other Locations Asia Pacific-Philippines-National Capital-Manila Organization Johnson & Johnson Pte. Ltd. (8435) Job Function R&D Requisition ID 2206006584W

The Johnson & Johnson Law Department seeks a Legal Counsel to join the Supply Chain, Real Estate, Procurement, Technology legal team (“SCRPT”), and provide legal support to various groups in Johnson & Johnson’s Logistics Procurement and “Deliver” organizations.  The Johnson & Johnson Deliver function is responsible for the transport, storage and distribution of Johnson & Johnson’s finished products, across the Pharmaceutical, Medical Devices and Consumer business sectors. Our team’s mission is to deliver strategic counsel and transactional excellence across the enterprise for Supply Chain, Real Estate, Procurement and Technology while mitigating risk, maintaining highly-effective partnerships and upholding consistency in legal practices and standards. The Legal Counsel – Deliver APAC will support drafting, negotiation and execution of material transactions across the Asia Pacific region, in a number of areas, and will partner with the Deliver and Logistics Procurement functions to ensure that J&J policies and processes are applied to protect J&J’s business interests, in line with Our Credo values. The Legal Counsel – Deliver APAC will also work with Deliver and Logistics Procurement to standardize and harmonize the procurement contracting experience and process, including assisting in the creation or implementation of new technologies, processes, and templates, as well as new training and escalation procedures, as needed. While this position will primarily support our Deliver function (logistics and distribution operations, including warehousing, transportation and customs brokerage), and Logistics Procurement, across the Asia Pacific region, the successful candidate will also collaborate with Law Department colleagues and business partners on other transactions and support as circumstances warrant, divestitures, acquisitions and strategic collaborations, as well as quality, regulatory and sustainability issues relevant to the functions supported by the global SCRPT legal team. The Legal Counsel – Deliver APAC will; provide legal counsel to business partners in the APAC Deliver function, and the Logistics Procurement team, covering the development, risk assessment and execution of multiple projects; draft and negotiate complex supply chain and procurement related agreements, with a focus on Johnson & Johnson’s Deliver function and related procurement activities (across logistics and distribution operations, including warehousing, transportation and customs brokerage); provide legal advice on various transactions to help ensure that they, and related agreements, meet business needs, comply with Johnson & Johnson policies and procedures, and that legal risks have been properly identified, assessed and mitigated; advise and support relevant business stakeholders across the Deliver function, and Logistics Procurement team, in the assessment and management of potential disputes; identify and adopt best practices, and support process improvement initiatives, in a continued effort to streamline legal processes in support of the Deliver function, and Logistics Procurement team, to improve timeliness, accuracy and quality in support of an increasing client base; collaborate closely with teams across the J&J Law Department, both in APAC and globally, to assist on, and co-ordinate, global, regional and /local initiatives and projects. co-ordinate relevant project work with outside counsel, as needed. Qualifications This position requires at least 5 years’ experience managing major projects and drafting and negotiating complex agreements, preferably in house at a multi-national corporation, or at a large or mid-sized law firm, with demonstrated excellent results, and preferably in or supporting the healthcare industry. This should include experience negotiating agreements in one or more relevant business areas, such as procurement or logistics and distribution (warehousing, transportation or customs brokerage). A law degree is required. Current licence / certification to practise as a lawyer in an appropriate jurisdiction. Good understanding of the legal ramifications and needs of the business environment in one or more of the above-mentioned areas, preferably cross-sector. Strong (virtual) team working skills – relationship management, interpersonal, communication (both written and spoken), negotiation and organizational skills. Strong business and analytical skills, problem solving ability, legal risk assessment skills. Proven ability to design, develop and deliver strategic and process improvement initiatives. Fluency in English with the capability of drafting contract terms and conditions in English, is required, while Chinese (Mandarin) or Japanese language skills (reasonable proficiency in spoken and ideally written language) would be an advantage. Experience of, and familiarity with, operating across two or more APAC jurisdictions (e.g. China, Japan, Singapore) would be beneficial. Primary Location Singapore-Singapore-Singapore- Organization Johnson & Johnson Pte. Ltd. (8435) Job Function Legal Requisition ID 2206008684W

Johnson & Johnson Consumer, a member of Johnson & Johnson’s Family of Companies, develops and markets skin care, baby care, wound care, hair care and Self Care products that address the needs of consumers and healthcare professionals and incorporate the latest innovations. Johnson & Johnson Consumer is recruiting for a Regulatory Affairs Associate Manager in Skin Health Regulatory Affairs team to support regulatory activities related to skincare brands such as Neutrogena, Aveeno, Clean & Clear, Johnson’s Adult in Asia Pacific region. The key responsibilities of Regulatory Affairs Associate Manager include but not limited to: Proactively work with cross functional business partners in strategic planning and provide innovative regulatory strategies/ direction to the business. Job_Descriptions: Manager, Sector Solutions, Group Wholesale Banking Manager, Sector Solutions, Group Wholesale Banking Posting Date: 06-Feb-2022 Location: SG Company: United Overseas Bank Limited About UOB United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values - Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers. About the Department The Wholesale Bank function operates a dynamic business model that provides financial services and solutions to help our clients achieve their strategic business objectives. Our mission is to become the premier-provider of banking services and solutions for Asia-based commercial banking companies (small medium enterprises), large corporations, financial institutions as well as multinational corporations. Our coverage teams work in full alignment with specialised teams across Transaction Banking, Investment Banking, Global Markets and Group Retail to deliver seamless solutions to our clients. Job Responsibilities Key responsibilities include: Prioritizing leads generation for assigned Sector; Providing insights packs and preparing the 'pitch' decks, jointly with Business Analytics team; Consolidating the MIS for tracking of sales force performance; Supporting the COE Head, Relationship Managers and Product Partners for acquisition and servicing of key strategic client relationships in individual market; Gathering insights from Relationship Managers / Product Partners in markets for Business Intelligence Team; Jointly developing the Sector Specific Value Propositions with Business Analytics, Product, Risk and Operations teams. Job Requirements Degree Bachelor's degree in - Economics, Finance, Accounting, Business Management, Engineering. 2-3 years experience in the banking coverage or credit analyst role Financial Modeling skill is preferred Proficient in powerpoint presentation skills Good understanding of Corporate / Commercial banking products Good interpersonal and communications skills Be a part of UOB Family UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application. Apply now and make a difference.

Responsible for supporting new product development and product maintenance through the application of Quality engineering skills for medical devices. Handle projects and tasks, from product inception through product launch and maintenance and play an active role in the processes to ensure products meet quality standards consistent with Business unit policies, while meeting all design control and other regulatory requirements. Team member representing Quality on new product development and sustaining engineering projects. Ensures that all design control and production / process control projects meet applicable regulatory (local and international), Corporate, and Business Unit requirements. Develop quality plans, execute inspection & testing activities and work further with Manufacturing on the transfer of quality requirements. Promotes the use of statistics in the testing and control of quality. Supports R&D in device product/process development and production activities, including the following: Develops and/or reviews product/process verifications/validation or test plans (protocols and reports). Develops and/or reviews product/process specifications and requirements. Develops and/or reviews product reliability specifications/predictions; reliability test activities. Conducts/coordinates risk management activities including review failure mode effects analysis (FMEA), hazard analysis, fault tree analysis (FTA) and/or risk or statistical analysis. Participates in product or process design and change activities, including design reviews. Provides technical support for product quality attributes/decisions. Coordinates selected verification/validation activities (e.g., toxicology/biocompatibility, sterilization validation, etc.) with external suppliers. Applies Design to Cost and Design for Manufacturability methods to support project leader in achievement of project objectives. Provides quality-related technical support to Unit Business(es). Contributes to assembly and maintenance of Design History Files (DHF). Ensures proper design and development documentation as per ISO 13485/FDA QSR Quality System. Creates, implements changes to, and maintains controlled documents as needed (e.g., SOPs, Specifications, Methods, etc.) to ensure strict compliance of R&D functional operation with ISO 13485/FDA QSR Quality System. Bachelor's Degree in Electrical, Mechanical or Industrial Engineering or equivalent (Mechanical, Biomedical, Polymer Engineering, Natural Sciences). Experience in the design and development of products in accordance with ISO 13485 guidelines. Job Description: Our client Cyber Security team is looking for passionate professional who is willing to learn how to perform cost recovery for industry leading cyber security services for our internal clients. The candidate will provide cost recovery services in an exciting and growing security organization within the organization across several cyber security domains, analyzing and resolving program cost recovery and billing issues. Your Roles and Responsibilities As a cyber security cost recovery analyst, you will be working with Cyber Security Technical and Program Management Leaders across the company to support projects and activities related to CISO initiatives. Under rare circumstances, you might be required to work abnormal hours while supporting recovery on a major cyber security incident or project. In this role you will need to be willing to learn and get involved in various programs/projects to understand specific business cases and business recovery models to plan and execute timely cost recovery for cyber security operations. As part of this role, you will learn a broad range of cyber security, project management and financial management skills across a very wide range of security services and programs. Required Skills: Bachelor's degree or ten (10) years of work experience in IT/Cyber Security related field; PMI or other relevant certifications is a plus General Project Management, Project Leadership, Project Financial Management skills and willingness to learn more Agile experience Capable of working under program management and technical leadership but self-motivated to take on mini-projects independently and report status to senior management An interest in Cyber Security and Financial Cost Recovery Ability to read and report accounting ledger data to manage project cost items and metrics Ability to set up POs, ICAs and DFI transaction billing for internal program recovery Microsoft Excel spreadsheet and power point presentation development Excellent business knowledge and interpersonal communication skills Problem solving skills and attention to detail Senior Consulting Services Experience: Two (2) or more years of senior level experience, delivering projects to internal and external clients. (e.g., Senior level consulting role with multi-tier clients) Senior skills/working knowledge of project management concepts and methodologies In-depth knowledge of information security concepts In-depth knowledge of cyber security tools, security standards and procedures Cristina Malabuyoc Malijan EA License No. 02C3423 Personnel Registration No. R1111547 Please note that your response to this advertisement and communications with us pursuant to this advertisement will constitute informed consent to the collection, use and/or disclosure of personal data by ManpowerGroup Singapore for the purpose of carrying out its business, in compliance with the relevant provisions of the Personal Data Protection Act 2012. Job_Title: Senior Vice President, Client Executive Team, Banks and Broker Dealers - Global Banking and Markets
Job_Descriptions: Posted by: Grace Magtolis Recruiter View profile & contact Some careers have more impact than others. If you’re looking for a career where you can make a real impression, join HSBC and discover how valued you’ll be. Whether you want a career that could take you to the top, or simply take you in an exciting new direction, HSBC offers opportunities, support and rewards that will take you further. Securities Services provides robust and reliable solutions that enhance performance and mitigate risk, today and in the future. Working with institutional investors, banks, insurance companies, governments and multinational corporations, Securities Services offers a range of fund administration, global custody, sub-custody and clearing, and corporate trust and loan agency services. We are currently seeking a high calibre professional to join our team as a Senior Vice President, Client Executive Team, Banks and Broker Dealers - Global Banking and Markets. Principal Responsibilities Act as a HSBC Brand Ambassador to build deep and lasting relationships with key client C-suite stakeholders in Asia, in order to retain existing and develop future business opportunities Develop your knowledge of key clients and decision makers to manage the relationships effectively, in line with the strategy for the business Understand client needs and requirements across different locations and be the champion of client centric culture by proposing & promoting Products and Services improvements and collaboration with other teams and departments to deliver value to clients Identify potential new business opportunities and liaise with wider HSBC group stakeholders especially across Platform Sales to progress Partner strategically with the Business Development team to ensure effective partnership in follow up of new business opportunities Regularly meet with key clients, building their trust, and work on an effective structure to monitor and develop the client experience Play a key role in Request for Proposal processes, to enable expansion of your client base Be responsible for pricing and monitoring of client level revenues within the sector Requirements To be successful in the role, you will need excellent relationship building, communicating and presentation skills Sound understanding of global banking, custody and clearing or securities services products Background in new client acquisition, client experience monitoring and client relationship management Experience with Japanese financial institutions coverage Strong interpersonal, analytical, problem solving, decision making skills and a team player To be considered for this role, the relevant rights to work in Singapore is required. You’ll achieve more when you join HSBC. www.hsbc.com/careers HSBC is committed to building a culture where all employees are valued, respected and opinions count. We take pride in providing a workplace that fosters continuous professional development, flexible working and opportunities to grow within an inclusive and diverse environment. Personal data held by the Bank relating to employment applications will be used in accordance with our Privacy Statement, which is available on our website. Issued by The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited.

Job_Title: First VP / VP, Project Manager, Planning , Performance & Standardization
Job_Descriptions: First VP / VP, Project Manager, Planning , Performance & Standardization First VP / VP, Project Manager, Planning , Performance & Standardization Posting Date: 07-Feb-2022 Location: Raffles Place, Singapore, SG Company: United Overseas Bank Limited About UOB United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values - Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers. About the Department The Technology and Operations function is comprised of five teams of specialists with distinct capabilities: business partnership, technology, operations, risk governance and planning support and services. We work closely together to harness the power of technology to support our physical and digital banking services and operations. This includes developing, centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches. Job Responsibilities • Overall Project Management : - Responsible and track the quality, scope, timeline, effort (co-related to estimation, CR's, complexity), resources (includes GTO, business, contractor, Professional Services resources as well as operations), - Develop and execute the overall project plan and analyse project proposals which impacts the schedule and budget variance which in turn contribute to meeting the overall objectives of the project. - Identify and schedule project deliverables, milestones and required activities and tasks. • Stakeholder Management : Work hand in hand with Business Project Managers to manage project stakeholders and relationships - e.g. escalation, expectation, conflict, scope changes, etc. Ensure teams work in a collaborative environment • Scope Management : Manage all changes to the agreed scope of work Review and assess all changes and impact to timeline and ensure all changes are approved by PSC • Project Governance : Prepare investment approval deck and manage approval of project by ITC/TPWC. Organize and facilitate PSC meetings, chair PWC meetings. • Risk and Issue Management : Manage overall project risk, track risk aging, work through escalations, change governance and related issues. Implement the risk mitigation plans. • Process Adherence : Partner with relevant stakeholders in ensuring that the system development methodology is followed and the relevant artefacts are delivered on time with quality, in adherence to the development methodology/approach • Project Reporting : Measure, monitor and report progress to stakeholders at various levels of organization across the enterprise with the right quality, consistency in content. Implement project communication plan and review status reports prepared by project personnel and modify schedules or plans as required Job Requirements Technical Skills & Experience • Three or more years of IT experience, with sensitivity and commitment to business problem solving • A minimum of two years of demonstrated competency in a junior or assistant project management role involving the execution of multiple projects or a large project • Three or more years of BU or BU-facing experience, with sensitivity and commitment to business problem solving • Demonstrated experience in leading a team • Demonstrated experience and ability in successfully utilizing "soft skills" or "people skills" • Knowledge of project planning tools. Familiar with and able to apply project management methodologies (for example, PMI, Prince II and agile) • Business Domain knowledge in at least one area (e.g. CRM) • Ability to lead and motivate others; demonstrating empathy and knowledge of personality types and appropriate management techniques • Good understanding of current and emerging technologies and how other enterprises are employing them to drive digital business • Demonstrated ability to develop and execute a project resource plan that ensures that the right people are in the right place doing the right things at the right time • Demonstrated sensitivity to working in a political environment and to interacting with senior leadership • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills; expertise in setting and managing customer expectations • Distinctive blend of business, IT, financial and communication skills, as this is a highly visible position with substantial impact • Effective influencing and negotiating skills in an environment where this role may not directly control resources • Strong knowledge and understanding of business needs, with the ability to establish rapport and maintain a high level of customer trust and confidence. Education • Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering or similar domain • Related professional/technical qualification will be advantageous although not mandatory Be a part of UOB Family UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application. Apply now and make a difference.

About the job: If you are looking to excel and make a difference, take a closer look at us…This position will play a vital role in reviewing, monitoring and identifying opportunities to improve and innovate end-to-end business processes, with the aim of achieving excellent customer experience journey while ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements and contributing to the Bank’s overall customer experience strategy. Summary: The job holder (a single-contributor role) will take a holistic Bank-wide approach to roll-out business processes that deliver the highest standard of customer experience, safeguard the Bank from reputational risk and execute service excellence initiatives. The role will work with internal cross-functional teams to ensure timely execution of identified areas of improvement and compliance with all policies, processes and standard operating procedures. He/She will also report any service gap(s) to the Senior Management Team and provide solutions & recommendations for improvement. In addition, the job holder will administer/oversee transformational initiatives and ensure that they are delivered within stipulated timelines. Responsibilities: Identify key drivers of business process improvement, influence decisions and gain consensus across the Bank. Cultivate service mindset to improve service levels and strengthen end-to-end processes to enhance customer experience. Manage key initiatives impacting customer experience through the standardisation & enhancement of SOPs, processes & policies to improve service quality and control. Develop and administer a system for collating multi-channelled customer insights and feedback. Analyse collated customer feedback so as to identify any gaps/lapses that might result in work process inefficiency. Thereafter, put in place a SOP to ensure timely escalation for resolution. Work closely with internal departments to improve customer service touchpoints across the Bank. Chair Service Quality Forums with internal departments. Create standard email reply templates & FAQs and disseminate them to employees at various customer touchpoints. Be the point of escalation for complex queries and complaints, and ensure prompt resolutions. Collaborate with internal stakeholders to establish clear performance goals for employees in customer-facing roles. Perform data analytics on service standards, present findings/insights and make recommendations for improvement to the Senior Management Team. Use customer service data as a medium to drive conversions, assist stakeholders in optimising resource deployment, and monitor impact on Business and service indicators/KPIs. Oversee/Administer transformational initiatives and projects to ensure that all internal departments play their part in meeting the stipulated project timelines. Requirements: A recognized Degree in any discipline. 5 to 7 years of relevant work experience in a similar role, in a Bank or Fintech environment, with good understanding of banking processes, products and services. Proven track record in driving cultural change, managing customer experience, process improvement, change management and transformational projects. Possess functional knowledge in managing/improving moderate to complex end-to-end processes that cut across 2 to 3 departments in a regulated environment. A self-starter with results-oriented mindset, takes ownership and initiative and possess the perseverance and resourcefulness to work through obstacles. Able to multi-task and drive desired outcomes with tight timelines. Excellent stakeholder and project management skills. Strong interpersonal and written communication skills.

Job_Title: Senior Legal & Compliance Manager- a fast expanding Financial Service Company in Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Posted by: Dyana Jumadi Recruiter View profile & contact Our client, a fast-expanding investment platform in Singapore is looking for a seasoned Senior Legal and Compliance specialist (new headcount) due to expansion of the business. This is an individual contributor and you will be working very closely with the team lead in handling legal requirements, compliance (including AML) and also risk management of the entity. Head, T&I Ways of Working About Standard Chartered We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East. To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. The Role Responsibilities Reporting to the Global Head, Strategy & Transformation for the Technology & Innovation group, T&I the Head of Ways of Working will be responsible for supporting the definition, management and implementation of the nWOW Transformation Strategy for the Technology and Innovation group (excluding SC Ventures). Strategy With a mandate from the Group Chief Digital, Technology & Innovation Officer (CDTIO) and its associated autonomy and authority, drive adoption of the new Ways of Working across T&I where relevant and support teams in taking on parts of these ways of working where appropriate Bring together the various functional and domain Heads and Leads of Transformation across T&I, to share best practices and foster a more holistic and efficient approach to new Ways of Working Transformation Create and evolve a consistent measurement approach and system, to improve the T&I transformation and challenge non-value-add metrics, in alignment with Group Strategy Support the functions and domains within T&I so that their transformation and approach aligns with the goals of their respective business partners Facilitate successful adoption of hybrid working across T&I Bridge the gap between the new Ways of Working and hybrid working and harness these to support the Bank in delivering Chapter 3 Business Be aware of and understand the wider business, economic and market environment in which the group operates Influence the T&I delivery responses and solutions to critical business problems Forge deep relationships with CIO business lines to ensure understanding and alignment of T&I transformation strategy Drive the development and adoption of new Ways of Working, including Agile, Client Obsession, Continuous Improvement, hybrid working, and any associated processes or tools, to be used by different businesses/functions/geographies Partner with the Group Transformation Office to optimise transformation efforts and ensure alignment with Group Transformation strategy People and Talent Lead through example and build the appropriate culture and values Set appropriate tone and expectations from the team and stakeholders Partner with Group HR to support the embedding of hybrid working and new Ways of Working across T&I and beyond Risk Management Responsible for identifying, assessing, monitoring, controlling and mitigating risks to the Group, as well as have firm treatment plans for all such risks and delivering on the treatment plans. Also, an awareness and understanding of the main risks facing the Group and the role the individual plays in managing them Ensure a full understanding of the risk and control environment within the T&I Strategy & Transformation organisation Act quickly and decisively when any risk and control weakness becomes apparent and ensure they are addressed within an appropriate timeframe and, if necessary, escalated through the relevant committees Regulatory & Business Conduct Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group's Values and Code of Conduct. Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct. Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters. Embed Here for good and Group's brand and values in the team Perform other responsibilities assigned under Group, Country, Business or Functional policies and procedures. Responsible for building a culture of good conduct Support the goal to achieve the outcomes set out in the Bank's Conduct Principles: Fair Outcomes for Clients; Effective Financial Markets; Financial Crime Compliance; The Right Environment. Key Stakeholders Group CDTIO, T&I Management Team members and their teams Group Transformation Office Group Human Resources Respective CIOs and their Business Partners Relevant Communities of Practices across T&I Other Responsibilities Embed Here for good and Group's brand and values in the T&I Strategy & Transformation Team Perform other responsibilities assigned under Group, Country, Business or Functional policies and procedures Responsible for building a culture of good conduct. Our Ideal Candidate 15 years in Technology Delivery and large-scale Transformation with experience in Agile Ways of Working, Human-Centred Design, Continuous Improvement, and Change Management Excellent organisation and leadership skills with ability to manage multiple deadlines and effectively prioritise Strong influencing skills and ability to collaborate effectively with colleagues at all levels Mandatory Skills: Process Re-engineering, Digital Transformation, Technology Transformation, Workforce Transformation, etc. Able to manage Risk, People & Conduct Academic or Professional Education/Qualifications: Bachelor's/Master's degree or equivalent Management/Technology Consulting experience Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions. To view information on our benefits including our flexible working please visit our career pages . We welcome conversations on flexible working.

Posted by: Malvika Chordia Recruiter View profile & contact Manager – Derivatives Ops – Regulatory Reporting Specialist Middle & Back Office Services: Role will support the Derivatives Operations team, especially with regards to regulatory reporting requirements of my client's trading activities. KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES Be the primary SME in regulatory reporting related projects. Keep abreast of the evolution of regulatory reporting requirements and ensure will be able to meet its regulatory reporting obligations and to stay ahead of the curve on new requirements. Perform oversight of regulatory reporting activities undertaken by delegated reporters. Daily monitoring of regulatory reporting activities ensuring timeliness, completeness, and accuracy of reportable trades via Markit MIR. Experience in detecting risks and issues and implement effective controls. Resolve operational issues with the relevant parties as and when they arise. Support Derivatives team with derivatives trades life cycle management and collateral management. Review the oversight process to ensure control framework is adequate at all levels to minimize operational risk. Review and periodically update of internal policies and procedures. Continuously seek to improve on current processes so that there are no major issues observed during audit or reviews. Support new fund launches and transitional activities by working closely with service providers and internal stakeholders such as Transitions Management, Product Team, etc to ensure all regulatory reporting requirements are fulfilled and duly setup for the running of the portfolio. Maintain strong working relationships with all external/internal clients as appropriate, ensuring clear and accurate communication and responding to queries in a timely manner. Work with internal stakeholders and relevant business areas on projects and other initiatives. EXPERIENCE / QUALIFICATIONS A Degree or equivalent preferably in Finance/ Accounting/ Data Science. Minimum 5 years’ experience back- office functions within the asset management industry. Strong understanding of derivatives regulatory reporting requirements in multiple jurisdictions especially MAS and EMIR. Knowledge on SFTR reporting. Experience in managing projects. Strong derivatives products (bilateral/cleared OTC and Exchange Traded) knowledge. Experience in reviewing OTCD documents: ISDA, CSA, CTA, etc. Able to prioritize tasks and manage time effectively to complete tasks within required deadlines. Strong process and systems orientation. Excellent general management capabilities and communication skills. Advanced Excel and Microsoft Office. Knowledge on Aladdin would be a plus. Ability to communicate effectively, strong analytical and problem-solving abilities Highly team orientated. Work towards and share best practice. Meticulous to detail. Ability to work effectively under pressure. Able to demonstrate flexibility and adaptability. Can do attitude.
